listOfSessions.title: Keynote: Medical Imaging with TensorFlow 2.0
listOfSessions.description: This is a two part talk. First, I'll introduce recent work in medical imaging, in which TensorFlow is used to assist physicians identify cancerous cells in gigapixel images. Next, I'll introduce new features in TensorFlow 2.0 (currently in beta, and due to be completed in a couple weeks). I'll close by pointing you to the latest educational resources.

listOfSessions.title: Containers, Kubernetes, and the Multi-cloud journey
listOfSessions.description: Starting at the base of portability we will dive into containers as a delivery method for applications, how they are orchestrated and even how to deploy those across multiple clouds. This will highlight the both open source build your own, and the benefits of using Google Cloud technologies to move faster and manage the underlying components.

listOfSessions.title: An Intro to Flutter
listOfSessions.description:
Let's cut the buzzwords. You don't care about phrases created by Marketing people, you care about what you could do with Flutter, if it really is faster and easier than what you're doing now, and if it's worth the time and expense it would take to get productive with it.

Scott Stoll has been around Flutter since its 9th commit, 0.0.14 Alpha. He does not possess a marketing degree nor is he certified in buzzword, but if you want straight answers to questions about Flutter, he's your guy.

listOfSessions.title: AI Testing
listOfSessions.description: Common Agile practice is to write lots of unit tests and API tests and only a few User Interface tests. Why? Because UI tests break easily and are hard to maintain. But what if we could use Tensorflow to help us out. Many of our apps have the same functionality such as login, checkout, shopping cart, share, pay etc. so we can train a neural network to help test our apps? In this session we'll look at how Test.ai uses Object Detection and Tensorflow on top of Appium to make our UI tests less brittle.

listOfSessions.title: Getting Comfortable with Google Analytics  - from Tag Manager to Data Studio
listOfSessions.description: Many developers need analytics for marketing their services or apps but do not know how to use the reports or where to start.  This session will cover the best technical and analysis practices for Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and other solutions for email, social media, and digital ads.

listOfSessions.title: TensorFlow in R Programming; A Beginner's Primer For Machine Learning
listOfSessions.description: TensorFlow provides developers with a capacity for developing deep learning models.   Long available for Python, TensorFlow became available for R programming in 2018.  This session is a straightforward overview of how to best manage data for machine learning using TensorFlow and R.

listOfSessions.title: Google Flutter: The Next Frontier in Mobile Development
listOfSessions.description:
Since its release in late 2018, Flutter has become one of the fastest growing programming languages. It is projected to grow in leaps and bounds with the release of Flutter for Web. In this presentation, I will talk about some new and exciting developments in the Flutter universe. I will demonstrate the following topics through some practical use cases.

I. animations with Flutter - An explanation of key animation concepts
II. Webviews in Flutter - An explanation of the plugin with an example
III. State Management - best practices in state management
IV. Flutter for Web - exciting development with which the single codebase is now extensible to web applications
V. Interesting Flutter Packages - showcases some of the latest packages

With each use case, the audience will discover the strength and utility of Flutter when applied to real-world programming instances. The presentation will not only introduce what is latest, but it would also show when and where to use the tools when coding with Flutter.

listOfSessions.title: Working Effectively with Non-Technical Co-Workers
listOfSessions.description:
Almost every thriving organization needs a variety of successful role players. A rational developer wants the sales person to succeed, not to mention the PMs, marketing, etc. If a PM or client manager is mixing up the terms "platform" and "framework" in front of a more tech-savvy customer, it could be embarrassing. Marketing people may come back a number of times to ask similar questions about a process or system the company offers. 

The answer to these potentially frustrating situations lies in communications skills that acknowledge a shared purpose and reality - which is simpler than that sounds. The ability to "translate" technical matters in to understandable language or concepts for non-techies is a less recognized but highly valued skill. Similarly, the non-techie that can articulate tech matters and be credible in their environment is also highly valued and is really good for the organization. 

In this talk, Baxtresser will provide some guideposts for these interactions that will result in communications that are clearer and more meaningful which will benefit you, your non-technical co-worker, and your organization or customer. When a successful question or situation dialog is resolved and finishes with greater understanding and increased retention, there are positive effects downstream internally, as well as with customers and/or users. Those good results will enable a greater degree of trust and respect in the professional relationship and in the organization.

listOfSessions.title: Blinded With Data Science: Extract Meaning from Chaos with Google Colaboratory
listOfSessions.description: Google Colaboratory is the fastest & easiest way to get up to speed with data science. Dive into the mechanics of machine learning as you write & execute live code alongside Scott, in any browser. Extract & polish unclean data, prep data for operations, run algorithms that create meaning from chaos.

listOfSessions.title: Getting Better Design Specs & Assets
listOfSessions.description:
Sometimes getting the right assets from your designers is a big pain. Missing bucket sizes, vectors that just don't work correctly, getting told that it'll take them days to resize the icons from Photoshop or Illustrator. Even if you suggest a tool to help them help you, they're unwilling to learn and set in their process.

Adobe XD exports assets in a way that developers can use right away. The best part is that it already integrates with the Creative Suite products that designers already use, making it much more likely they'll actually use it. We'll go through what you can expect from Adobe XD as a developer, as well as exploring the designer's side so you can win them over and make ASSETS_FINAL_FINAL.zip a thing of the past.

listOfSessions.title: Machine Learning on GCP 2019: AI Platform - AI for Everything
listOfSessions.description:
This presentation will provide a broad overview of how someone can utilize the GCP AI Platform.  There is A LOT to cover!  Off-the-shelf features (like Vision and Natural Language), using general features (like the virtual machine, Storage, and Dataflow) to spin up your own machine learning models, hosted notebooks, notebook templates for quick-starting most AI projects, end-to-end AI pipelines, enterprise sharing capabilities, all kinds of container templates optimized for AI, automated ML (AutoML), and much more.  So yes, definitely, AI for everything!

We won't just list what's available though, you get can get that from the website.  We'll also provide in-depth coverage of how to get started, what to use in different scenarios, and where the secret gems are on that platform to take your AI efforts to the next level.  And last, we'll cover a couple extra Google-related services that aren't in the AI Platform, but may also be helpful to be aware of for optimal AI efforts!

listOfSessions.title: Flutter: Don't be afraid, State Management is your Friend
listOfSessions.description:
In this talk I will talk about some architectures in Flutter, to then show an example application and how it can be more complicated if we do not use an appropriate pattern.

Finally I will implement an architecture based on the Provider package and as if making minimal changes in the code, we can reduce the complexity.

listOfSessions.title: Comprehensive Voice/Chat Interactions for Google Assistant
listOfSessions.description: In recent years, virtual assistants have had a massive boost in large scale usage with Siri, Alexa and Google Assistant being household names. This surge has brought more interest in expanding the implementations of such assistants and their ease of integration for common services such as customer service chatbots. Google created its very own voice development suite, Dialogflow, which uses standard voice concepts like intents, entities and context in its framework. We'll learn how to implement not only a basic chatbot, but take it further and see just how creative we can get by taking advantage of the advancements in voice development technology.

listOfSessions.title: Our DevFest Website - Flutter for Web and What I Learned
listOfSessions.description:
The Michigan DevFest website you are currently viewing this abstract on was built in Flutter for Web by Don Ward. 

In this talk, we will talk about the current state of Flutter for Web and considerations for developing a website using it.

listOfSessions.title: Demystifying Data Science
listOfSessions.description:
Today's world generates different kinds of data at unbelievably rapid rates. This has resulted in a shift away from traditional software development towards Data Science. This talk gives an overview of Data Science and delves deep into the pipeline data scientists use - right from fetching the data, the tools and frameworks used to creating models, gaining insights and telling a story. The session is aimed towards aspiring data scientists - hobbyists and professionals alike. Data-curious folks interested in knowing what the field of Data Science entails are welcome to attend too.
* Trivia about data / need for data science
* Explaining Buzzwords / clearing out the jargon
* Capabilities of data science
* Applications of data science across industries
* Overview of the data science pipeline
* What questions can data science answer?
* Different sources of data
* Data wrangling and cleaning
* Data exploration
* Building models and using algorithms
* Data visualization and storytelling
* Ethics in Data Science
* Additional resources

By the end of this session, audience members will have a better grasp of the capabilities and processes of Data Science. They will be familiar with the general structure of a Data Science pipeline and will develop a strong foundation to continue learning and experimenting in Data Science.

listOfSessions.title: What Little Caesars is Doing with Flutter
listOfSessions.description:
Little Caesars took the leap and built a full business facing app in Flutter. In this session, we'll demonstrate our modern Flutter app and tips and tricks on:
* How we built the
	o Calendar
	o Image banners
	o Lists
* What we love best about Flutter
	o Speed of development
	o Ease of learning DART
	o Performance of app
* What Flutter made easier for us
	o Single code base for Apple and Android
	o Flutter modules, rather than having to use native iOS and Android modules
* Lessons learned
	o How we solved issues such as how Flutter loads the page hierarchy (which caused performance issues).
* Frankenstein Flutter
	o Our experiments with mixing Flutter and native Android and iOS

We'll also discuss:
* The Flutter vs. React Native debate and reveal why we ultimately chose Flutter.
* The future of Flutter, its community, and what we're really excited about.

And demo:
* How to get started!  (Code demo, installation demo, etc.)

listOfSessions.title: Microaggressions in the Workplace
listOfSessions.description: Let's face it. You've probably had some stuff said to you at work that made you feel crappy. But did the person who said it know how crappy it actually was? Microaggressions are small, often seemingly harmless comments that can make people in any kind of underrepresented community feel out of place or talked down to. Maybe you've observed this behavior from other coworkers, but haven't known how to go about correcting them? This session is for folks of all genders, races, sexual orientations, and ages who want to be a little more conscious about the way they treat one another. You'll leave with plenty of examples of how to recognize microaggressions and how to deal, whether you're the recipient, the supplier, or the passer-by.

listOfSessions.title: Kubernetes security best practices you need to know
listOfSessions.description: We will go over essential Kubernetes security best practices that can reduce the risk and attack surface of your cluster.

listOfSessions.title: Intro to Kotlin
listOfSessions.description: With this introduction you will leave with knowledge of Kotlin itself, as well as some commonly used practices. In the talk we will cover things like; why learn Kotlin, Java vs Kotlin, nullability, immutability, high-order functions, and much more.

listOfSessions.title: Moving conversations with robots from science fiction to reality
listOfSessions.description:
Voice interfaces are everywhere. In fact, two-thirds of products showcased at CES 2019 featured some form of voice control. Yet think of your most recent interactions with robot or assistant interfaces, you likely left feeling underwhelmed. Today's Voice UI doesn't live up to our expectations and its all Science Fiction's fault! For over a century pop culture has made promises, like a hoverboard, that technology hasn't managed to keep. We can change all that. Conversation designers of today can make interfaces that amaze and delight, we just need to understand the rules. 

Join me in examining various robots of popular culture from movies to books and even video games. We'll learn what humanity expects from voice interactions and the source of those ideas. Finally, I'll share tools and techniques to create engaging conversational interfaces that amaze audiences as much as those created long ago, in galaxies far far away.

listOfSessions.title: Git at Scale
listOfSessions.description: In this talk, Brett will share how to create a Git PR all the way through to making it scale for you.

listOfSessions.title: I Can't See: Low Vision A11y & Users
listOfSessions.description:
When you think of low vision, what comes to mind? A user that is near sighted? How about far sighted? Maybe partially blind? These are all qualifying cases of poor vision, but low vision is more complicated than the prescription of glasses or contacts.

According to the World Health Organization, they categorize low vision based on specific levels of visual acuity and field of vision (W3.org, 2016). With that in mind, we as developers can look at different categories of low vision including color vision, visual acuity, contrast sensitivity, etc and make an effort to bake in things like zoom, non-conflicting colors, and re-wrapping of columns in to our code.

My talk will cover what vision accessibility is, different categories of low vision, what the needs of the users are, and what we as developers can do to achieve a great user experience for low vision users.

listOfSessions.title: Modern Rapid Web Development using Angular Material, AngularFire, and Firebase
listOfSessions.description:
After acquiring Fabric and Crashlytics in 2016 and launching Cloud Firestore in 2017; Firebase has become much stronger than even and is positioned to become the choice of "Mobile and Web Application Development Platform" for Developers. In this presentation, I will talk about some new and exciting developments in the Firebase, Angular Material, AngularFire and NgRx. I will demonstrate the following topics through some practical use cases.

1.       Mat-Datepicker and Mat-table - An explanation of how to use the components in your project
2.       Observer pattern using RxJs - A deep dive into Observer Design pattern using RxJs
3.       Cloud-Firestore - A look into Steps needed to setup Cloud FireStore for your project
4.       Authentication - Exlpore how to Authenticate users simply and securely
5.       AngularFire - An example of how to using AngularFireStore and AngularFireAuth can reduce application complexity and boost productivity
6.       Hosting - show you how easy it is to move your code to Firebase hosting from CLI
7.       NgRx - Explain how State Management works using an Analogy with American Democracy.

listOfSessions.title: EXTRA BONUS: TensorFlow Office Hours with Josh Gordon
listOfSessions.description:
Office Hours with Josh Gordon of the TensorFlow team immediately after his keynote.

This will run as long as needed in the Board Room.

listOfSessions.title: The Rosie Pattern Language and TDD
listOfSessions.description: Onorio will be discussing the Rosie Pattern Language (RPL) — a new approach to pattern matching in text. The famous joke "A developer has a problem. He thinks to himself, 'I know! I'll use a regex!' Now he has two problems" — well RPL is all about making sure you don't have two problems when you're done with your pattern matching.
